org.typemeta.funcj.control

Interface Validation<E,T>

  • Type Parameters:
    E - the error type
    T - the successful result type
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Validation.Failure, Validation.Success

    public interface Validation<E,T>
    Union type of a successfult result and a list of errors.

    A Validation<T> value is either the sub-type Validation.Failure<T> which wraps an list of errors, or the sub-type Validation.Success<T> which wraps a value of type T.

    Null values are not allowed.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • traverse

        static <E,T,U> Validation<E,IList<U>> traverse(IList<T> lt,
                                               Functions.F<T,Validation<E,U>> f)
        Standard applicative traversal.

        Equivalent to 

        sequence(lt.map(f))
        .
        Type Parameters:
        E - the error type
        T - the type of list elements
        U - the type wrapped by the Try returned by the function
        Parameters:
        lt - the list of values
        f - the function to be applied to each value in the list
        Returns:
        a Validation which wraps an IList of values

      • sequence

        static <E,T> Validation<E,IList<T>> sequence(IList<Validation<E,T>> lvt)
        Standard applicative sequencing.

        Translate a IList of Validation into a Validation of an IList, by composing each consecutive Validation using the apply(Validation) method.

        Type Parameters:
        E - the error type
        T - the value type of the Validations in the list
        Parameters:
        lvt - the list of Validation values
        Returns:
        a Validation which wraps an IList of values

        <R> R match(Functions.F<Validation.Failure<E,T>,R> failure,
            Functions.F<Validation.Success<E,T>,R> success)
        Apply one of two functions to this value, according to the type of value.
        Type Parameters:
        R - the return type of functions
        Parameters:
        failure - the function to be applied to Failure values
        success - the function to be applied to Success values
        Returns:
        the result of applying either function

      • map

        <U> Validation<E,U> map(Functions.F<T,U> f)
        Functor function application. If this value is a Success then apply the function to the value, otherwise if this is a Failure then leave it untouched.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the function return type
        Parameters:
        f - the function to be applied
        Returns:
        a Validation that wraps the function result, or the original failure

      • apply

        <U> Validation<E,U> apply(Validation<E,Functions.F<T,U>> vf)
        Applicative function application (inverted). If the vf parameter is a Success value and this is a Success value, then apply the function wrapped in the tf to this.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the return type of function
        Parameters:
        vf - the function wrapped in a Validation
        Returns:
        a Validation wrapping the result of applying the function, or a Failure value

      • flatMap

        <U> Validation<E,U> flatMap(Functions.F<T,Validation<E,U>> f)
        Monadic bind/flatMap. If this is a Success then apply the function to the value and return the result, otherwise return the Failure result.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the type parameter to the Validation returned by the function
        Parameters:
        f - the function to be applied
        Returns:
        the result of combining this value with the function f

      • and

        default <U> Validation.ApplyBuilder._2<E,T,U> and(Validation<E,U> vb)
        Builder API for chaining together n Validations, and applying an n-ary function at the end.
        Type Parameters:
        U - the successful result type for next Validation
        Parameters:
        vb - the next Validation value to chain
        Returns:
        the next builder
